data.title: All 23 Nonso Anozie Movies (in Order)
data.meta_description: In this captivating roundup, we take a closer look at the diverse filmography of Nonso Anozie, a talented actor known for his powerful performances on both the big and small screen. From…
data.text:
In this captivating roundup, we take a closer look at the diverse filmography of Nonso Anozie, a talented actor known for his powerful performances on both the big and small screen. From action-packed dramas to thought-provoking indies, we explore his impressive range and discuss the unique qualities that make each of these Nonso Anozie Movies stand out.

As an Amazon Associate I earn from qualifying purchases.

1. Atonement (2007)

Based on the award-winning novel by Ian McEwan, “Atonement” (2007) follows the life-altering consequences of a young girl’s actions. Thirteen-year-old Briony Tallis, a budding writer, wrongly accuses her sister’s lover of a horrendous crime, setting off a series of events that forever change the course of their lives. The movie unfolds against the backdrop of World War Two, with each character navigating the complexities of love, guilt, and redemption.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

3. RocknRolla (2008)

RocknRolla is an action-packed, crime thriller that takes us into the shadowy, dangerous world of London’s criminal underworld. Directed and written by Guy Ritchie, the film sees a Russian mobster mastermind a corrupt land deal that sets off a feeding frenzy among the city’s most ruthless gangs. With millions of dollars at stake, loyalties will be tested, and alliances forged in this wild, adrenaline-fueled race to claim the prize.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

4. Happy-Go-Lucky (2008)

Happy-Go-Lucky” is a delightful film that takes a heartwarming look at the life of Poppy, a positive and vibrant schoolteacher living in North London. Her infectious optimism often leaves those around her feeling exasperated, as she lights up every room she enters. The movie follows Poppy as she navigates through various chapters in her life, providing a glimpse into her happy-go-lucky lifestyle.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

5. Cass (2008)

Cass” is the gripping untold story of an orphaned Jamaican baby, taken in by an elderly white couple and raised in an all-white neighborhood in London. Despite his humble beginnings, he rises to become one of the most feared and respected figures in Britain. This gripping biographical drama is based on real events and promises a thrilling and emotional journey.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

6. I Am Slave (2010)

I Am Slave, a gripping biographical drama thriller set in London, unfolds the harrowing tale of a woman’s unwavering fight for freedom amidst the ruthless slave trade. In London, a Sudanese slave struggles to break free from the oppressive chains that bind her, facing the harsh realities of the human trafficking industry. As the stakes grow higher, the protagonist’s resilience and strength are put to the test as she battles her captors.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

7. Nanny McPhee Returns (2010)

In the heartwarming comedy “Nanny McPhee Returns, “ young mother Isabel Green (Maggie Gyllenhaal) struggles to run her family farm as her husband is away at war. Nanny McPhee (Emma Thompson), with her uncanny magic and unconventional approach, steps in to teach a powerful lesson to Isabel’s children and two spoiled cousins. The farm may be in turmoil, but Nanny McPhee brings light and fun to their lives, turning their frowns upside-down.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

8. Brighton Rock (2010)

Brighton Rock” is a chilling crime drama that follows teenage gangster, Pinkie, as he spirals into violence, corruption, and a dangerous game of cat-and-mouse with the police. Set against the backdrop of 1960s Brighton, the film portrays Pinkie’s quest for power within the gang, despite his desperate attempts to seek redemption.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

9. The Grey (2011)

In the face of unforgiving nature, a group of oil workers must band together for survival after their plane crashes in the heart of Alaska. Led by a skilled huntsman (played by Liam Neeson), the group is pursued by a pack of merciless wolves, each step a struggle for their lives.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

10. Conan the Barbarian (2011)

In the heart of an ancient world, a fierce and relentless barbarian warrior, Conan (played by Jason Momoa), embarks on a mission fueled by vengeance. The brutal warlord Khalar Zym (Ron Perlman) viciously attacked Conan’s village, mercilessly executing the little boy’s father. Now, as he transforms from a slave into a fearsome warrior, Conan is out for blood, using every ounce of strength to destroy the very evil that brought him to this perilous journey.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

12. Ender’s Game (2013)

Get ready for a thrilling adventure in the year 2054 when “Ender’s Game” hits theaters! . Young Ender Wiggin, a brilliant strategist and natural leader, is recruited by the International Military to save humanity from another alien invasion by the Formics. Despite being just 6 years old, Ender must harness his skills and overcome manipulations from the military to save Earth from a fate worse than death.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

13. Jack Ryan: Shadow Recruit (2014)

In “Jack Ryan: Shadow Recruit, “ Chris Pine stars as a young and ambitious CIA analyst, Jack Ryan, in a thrilling tale of espionage and global intrigue. When Ryan stumbles upon a chilling plot to destroy the U. S. economy, he must risk everything to stop the deadly terrorist attack at its source.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

14. Get Santa (2014)

Get Santa, released in 2014 and directed by Christopher Smith, is a heartwarming comedy-fantasy film that celebrates the spirit of Christmas. When Santa Claus is wrongfully arrested and thrown in jail, a recently paroled man and his young son join forces to save the holiday and restore the magic of Christmas. With the help of some mischievous reindeer and a bit of good humor, they embark on an exciting adventure that proves that nothing is impossible when you believe in the power of love and Christmas spirit.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

15. Son of God (2014)

Son of God (2014) delves into the life story of Jesus Chirst, from his birth to the ultimate resurrection. A captivating portrayal of the life of both a son and a God, the film brilliantly paints a picture of Jesus’ teachings, crucifixion, and rebirth. Aside from the spiritual and historical elements, the movie also focuses on the emotional journey between Jesus and his mother. With a PG-13 rating, Son of God is a powerful cinematic experience that enthralls and enlightens audiences.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

16. Pan (2015)

Pan” is an enthralling tale that takes you back to 1940s Neverland with its stunning blend of action, adventure, and comedy. The protagonist, twelve-year-old orphan Peter, discovers a whole new magical world filled with excitement, challenge, and the road to his destiny as a child hero.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

19. 7 Days in Entebbe (2018)

Inspired by the real-life events of a 1976 Air France hijacking, 7 Days in Entebbe captures the adrenaline-pumping story of the most daring rescue mission in history. Set against the backdrop of hostage negotiation, the film explores a female terrorist’s dangerous game and the bravery of the Israeli forces. Following the tagline, “In Entebbe, Uganda, they held them hostage. .

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

21. The Laundromat (2019)

The Laundromat” is a riveting comedy-crime drama that follows the gripping narrative of a grieving widow who embarks on a mysterious and perilous journey. A woman, driven by the loss of her husband, discovers an intricate web of insurance fraud and financial corruption, ultimately chasing down leads to a pair of ruthless Panama City law partners. This film masterfully breaks the fourth wall, captivating audiences with its unconventional storytelling approach.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art
